Points to include

This is a list of things to mention:

  • Provide introspective awareness of issues.
  • Facts pertaining to social media use (fair representation: good + bad)
  • Display small easy steps to take, which are largely non-intrusive.
  • Issues to ask reader to consider include:
    • Time Spend
    • Value Gained
    • Ask how much comparison is caused by social media.
      • Ask if the comparison leads to a negative emotional experience.
    • Ask the reader about other people they know who have had positive experiences without social media.
  • Display alternative ways to spend time.
    • Ask the reader to come up with them.
  • Be concrete:
    • DON'T claim that social media is the cause of all problems mentioned.
    • DON'T claim that removing social media fixes all problems mentioned.
    • DON'T claim that the only option is to remove social media.
  • Ask about:
    • If the time spend reflects the value gained

Keep in mind

Stages of change are continuous, and people jump around:

  • Pre-contemplative
  • Contemplation
  • Determination
  • Action (actually do a change)
  • Maintenance
